News.Title: MedPlus Allots 2.32 Lakh Shares Under ESOP 2021
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services allotted 2,32,061 equity shares to employees under ESOP 2021 scheme on January 30, 2026, increasing paid-up share capital to ₹24.01 crore with shares exercised at ₹628 and ₹232 per share.

News.Title: MedPlus Health Services Q3FY26 Results
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services reported strong Q3FY26 performance with consolidated revenue of ₹18,061.18 million, up 15.67% YoY, and net profit of ₹577.88 million, marking 26.00% growth compared to Q3FY25.

News.Title: MedPlus Health Services Q3FY26 Earnings Call Feb 2
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services announces earnings call on February 02, 2026 at 4:00 PM IST to discuss Q3FY26 financial results for quarter ended December 31, 2025 under SEBI regulations.

News.Title: MedPlus Health Services Unit Faces Drug License Suspension in Andhra Pradesh
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services has experienced a drug license suspension affecting one of its units in Andhra Pradesh.

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Receives Three-Day Drug License Suspension in Telangana
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services Limited disclosed that its subsidiary, Optival Health Solutions Private Limited, received a suspension order for a drug license at a store located at Nagole X Roads, Shameerpet, Telangana. The Assistant Director of Drugs Control Administration, Telangana issued the three-day suspension under Rule 65 of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. The company estimates a potential revenue loss of Rs 1.73 lacs due to this suspension.

News.Title: MedPlus Reports 6.3% Revenue Growth and 5.3% EBITDA Margin in Q2 FY26
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services reported consolidated revenue of INR 16,793 million for Q2 FY26, with consolidated operating EBITDA at INR 887 million representing 5.3% margin. The pharmacy operations grew 6.3% year-on-year on net basis and 8.8% on GMV basis. The company added 145 new stores during the quarter, achieving net addition of 117 stores compared to 101 in the previous quarter, bringing total network to 4,930 stores. Private label sales constituted 21.5% of total revenues, with pharma at 12.1% and non-pharma at 9.6%. Stores older than 12 months generated INR 15,338 million revenue with 11.8% store-level EBITDA margin and 68.6% store-level operating ROCE. The diagnostics segment recorded revenue of INR 332.5 million with 15.3% operating EBITDA margin. The company maintains its outlook for adding 600 new stores in fiscal 2026 and expects same-store sales growth to reach high single digits of 9-10% over the next two years.

News.Title: Medplus Health Services Reports 43% Jump in Quarterly Net Profit to 555 Million Rupees
News.Summary: Medplus Health Services reported quarterly net profit of 555 million rupees compared to 387 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue increased to 16.79 billion rupees from 15.76 billion rupees year-on-year. EBITDA rose to 1.5 billion rupees from 1.24 billion rupees, while EBITDA margin improved to 8.86% from 7.89% in the previous year.

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Receives Drug License Suspension Order in Maharashtra
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services Limited disclosed that its subsidiary, Optival Health Solutions Private Limited, received a suspension order for a drug license of a store located in Shanti Nagar, Nagpur, Maharashtra. The suspension is for twenty-one days and was issued by the Assistant Commissioner Licensing Authority, Food Drug Administration, Maharashtra, Nagpur. The order was received on November 1, 2025, under Rule 65 of Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. The company estimates a potential revenue loss of Rs 4.34 lacs due to this suspension.

News.Title: MedPlus Health Services Receives Stay Orders Against Suspension in Maharashtra
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services Limited has received two stay orders against a suspension from authorities in Nagpur and Amravati, Maharashtra. The company referenced earlier submissions made on August 6, 2025 and August 14, 2025 regarding the suspension matter. The stay orders will be made available on the company's website and stock exchange websites.

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces Drug License Suspension in Andhra Pradesh
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services Limited announced that its subsidiary, Optival Health Solutions Private Limited, received a suspension order for a drug license at a store in Rajamahendravaram, E.G District, Andhra Pradesh. The Assistant Director of District sales licensing Authority issued a seven-day suspension under Rule 65 of Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. The company estimates a potential revenue loss of Rs 1.75 lacs due to this suspension.

News.Title: Medplus Health Services Plans Aggressive Expansion with 120-150 New Stores Quarterly
News.Summary: Medplus Health Services announced plans to accelerate cluster-based expansion beyond Tier-1 cities, targeting the addition of approximately 120-150 stores quarterly. The company aims to increase its private-label product mix across both pharmaceutical and FMCG categories. The expansion strategy includes deepening omni-channel capabilities with delivery services in under 2 hours and implementing technology-driven efficiency measures to achieve profitable scale.

News.Title: MedPlus Health Services Reports Strong Q2 Growth with 43% Jump in Net Profit
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services delivered robust quarterly performance with consolidated net profit rising to 555 million rupees from 387 million rupees year-over-year. Revenue increased to 16.79 billion rupees compared to 15.76 billion rupees in the same period last year. The company's EBITDA grew to 1.5 billion rupees from 1.24 billion rupees, while EBITDA margin improved to 8.86% from 7.89% year-over-year, indicating enhanced operational efficiency alongside revenue growth.

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces Drug License Suspensions at Two Store Locations
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services Limited disclosed that its subsidiary Optival Health Solutions Private Limited received two drug license suspension orders. The Assistant Director of Drugs Control Administration in Vijayapura, Karnataka suspended the license for five days at a store on Bus stand Road, while the Khammam, Telangana authority suspended the license for three days at a store on Bus station road Thorrur. Both suspensions were issued under Rule 65 of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. The company estimates potential revenue losses of Rs 1.12 lacs for the Vijayapura store and Rs 0.39 lacs for the Telangana store.

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces Drug License Suspensions at Two Karnataka Stores
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services Limited disclosed that its subsidiary, Optival Health Solutions Private Limited, received suspension orders for drug licenses at two store locations in Karnataka. The Assistant Director of Drugs Control Administration suspended the license for five days at the Vijayapura store and one day at the Rajarajeshwari Nagar store. The suspensions were issued under Rule 65 of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. The company estimates potential revenue losses of approximately Rs. 1.12 lakhs for the Vijayapura store and Rs. 1.71 lakhs for the Rajarajeshwari Nagar store.

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces Drug License Suspensions at Two Telangana Stores
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services Limited announced that its subsidiary Optival Health Solutions Private Limited received suspension orders for drug licenses at two stores in Telangana. The Assistant Director of Drugs Control Administration, Medchal issued the suspensions for two and five days respectively at stores located in Balanagar Ground Floor and 3rd Phase Kphb. The suspensions were imposed for violations under Rule 65 of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. The company estimates potential revenue losses of approximately Rs. 0.48 lacs and Rs. 1.28 lacs for the affected stores respectively.

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces Drug License Suspensions at Two Telangana Stores

The suspension was issued by the Assistant Director of Drugs Control Administration, Quthubullapur, Telangana, under Rule 65 of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces 7-Day Drug License Suspension in Andhra Pradesh

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces Drug License Suspensions at Two Store Locations
News.Summary: MedPlus Health Services Limited disclosed that its subsidiary, Optival Health Solutions Private Limited, received suspension orders for drug licenses at two store locations. News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces 15-Day Drug License Suspension in Maharashtra

News.Summary: Optival Health Solutions Private Limited, a subsidiary of MedPlus Health Services Limited, received a seven-day suspension order for its Drug License for a store located on Kalyanadurgham Road in Andhra Pradesh. News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces Drug License Suspensions at Two Stores, Revenue Impact Rs 5.39 Lakhs
News.Summary: Optival Health Solutions Private Limited, a subsidiary of MedPlus Health Services Limited, received suspension orders for drug licenses at two store locations. The Assistant Director of Drugs Control Administration in Karnataka suspended the license for three days at a store in Fort Main Road Old Hubli, resulting in potential revenue loss of Rs 0.79 lakhs. Additionally, the District Sales Licensing Authority in Andhra Pradesh suspended the license for ten days at a store in Venkataramana Colony Main Road, Kurnool District, with potential revenue loss of Rs 4.60 lakhs. Both suspensions were issued under Rule 65 of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. The orders were received on September 18, 2025, with total potential revenue impact of approximately Rs 5.39 lakhs.

News.Title: MedPlus Subsidiary Faces Drug License Suspensions at Two Stores, Expects Rs 4.06 Lacs Revenue Loss

Both suspensions were issued under Rule 65 of Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940 and Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945.
